title: Erin Molan's random acts of kindness revealed amid Andrew Johns 'feud'
text:
Footy fans have rallied behind Erin Molan following reports she is feuding with NRL legend and fellow commentator Andrew Johns.

The 37-year-old Channel Nine journalist has been subjected to vicious online trolling and bullying over her supposed 'rivalry' with Johns.

But the tide is slowly turning in Molan's favour, with the chorus of abuse being replaced with widespread support and anecdotal accounts of Molan's kindness towards fans.

Supportive: Footy fans have rallied behind Erin Molan following reports she is feuding behind the scenes with fellow NRL commentator Andrew Johns

'Don't let the trolls get to you. You're a fantastic presenter but a better person,' one NRL supporter tweeted.

'My son was on the Sunday Footy Show a few years ago and the kindness and care you showed a couple of nine year olds was a direct reflection of what a great person you are.'

Another wrote: 'You are a class act Erin, one of the best sports broadcasters on Aussie TV. You recently came in to a shop I was in to grab some lunch and some footy fans asked you for a pic. You were so lovely, big smiles all around. Stay strong, my friend.'

'Erin Molan, so many of us admire the hell out of you. You're smart, professional, articulate, knowledgeable and damn good at your job. Keep rockin' your bad self, you're nailing it,' a third fan tweeted.

'So many of us admire the hell out of you: Fans have flocked to Twitter to defended the Nine sports presenter after she broke down during a live radio interview on Thursday

A further comment read: 'I can't believe this is even a topic - it's upsetting. Erin, you are incredible and I love turning the footy on and seeing your face!

'Don't listen to all the negative keyboard warriors - they are jealous of the wonderful job you are doing.'

'I hope a smile can come back to your face soon. Keep being you Erin you are the ultimate professional, super talented at your work and a joy to listen to,' another fan added.

Clash? The support comes amid reports Andrew Johns (far right) doesn't get along with Molan (left), who replaced Paul 'Fatty' Vautin on The Footy Show last year. Pictured during a Channel Nine broadcast with fellow commentator Ryan Girdler (centre)

The support comes amid reports Andrew Johns doesn't get along with Molan, who replaced Paul 'Fatty' Vautin on The Footy Show last year.

'Joey [Johns] has never been a fan of Erin, which isn't fair because she works her a**e off... The whole Footy Show thing, with Fatty being booted, that is where it started to go sour,' an insider previously told The Daily Telegraph.

Johns also removed himself from The Footy Show panel around the same time Vautin was replaced by Molan.

'They are jealous of the wonderful job you are doing': Fans have also revealed Molan's surprising acts of kindness

Meanwhile, Johns also cannot stand the fact that Molan repeatedly interrupts her fellow Channel Nine commentators and giggles while on air.

'He just doesn't like working with her,' a source told Daily Mail Australia on Wednesday.

'Joey is a stubborn bastard,' they added. 'If somewhere along the line she's p***ed him off he'll probably carry it around for the rest of his life.'

Clash? On Wednesday, a source told Daily Mail Australia that Johns (pictured) cannot stand the fact that Molan repeatedly interrupts her fellow Nine commentators and giggles while on air

Following reports of a feud, Molan has been widely criticised online by NRL fans, who have made it clear they would rather see Johns in the commentary box.

On Thursday, Molan broke down during a live radio appearance on WSFM's Jonesy and Amanda as she revealed she was having a 'rough' time in the lead up to Sunday's NRL Grand Final.

'I am so sorry, I haven't put my contacts in this morning. I had a rough night. I didn't sleep very well and these are prescriptions,' Molan said, explaining why she was wearing dark sunglasses in the studio.
description: Footy fans have rallied behind Erin Molan following reports she is feuding  with NRL legend and fellow commentator Andrew Johns.
authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
